comment.body: I remember when this drive was first announced. They basically said "we know this shouldn't work, but it does for some reason."
I'm very interested in bcachefs. It looks like support for encryption was just released. It'll probably be a while before this is mainlined though...
Running great on the Nexus5 (hammerhead). I've been running the pre-release roms, and the new nightly is stable as well.
@ks: Yeah, I'm not sure what they were going for with that animation. In any case, I personally always disliked the Cyanogen robot. I'm just glad that's gone!

I've heard that certain apps will refuse to run, or won't run correctly if root is detected. Things like banking apps that check for the existance of an su binary. I haven't run across anything like this myself, since I don't really use all that many apps either.
@Rythyrix: Thanks, I'll check those out if/when I run into any troublesome apps!
